content: This clause describes the specification of cybersecurity requirements and the architectural design (see 10.4.1).
It also describes integration and verification activities (see 10.4.2).
Cybersecurity activities are performed iteratively until no further refinements of cybersecurity controls are needed.
Cybersecurity specifications are defined and verified to confirm fulfilment of the cybersecurity concept.

Product development activities may follow a V-model-based workflow where design corresponds to the left side and verification to the right side, applicable to multiple abstraction levels such as item, component, and sub-component.
The objectives of this clause are to:
b) verify that the defined cybersecurity specifications conform to higher-level specifications;
c) identify weaknesses in the component; and
d) provide evidence that implementation and integration of components conform to the cybersecurity specifications.
Cybersecurity specifications from higher levels of abstraction [WP-10-01] shall be available, limited to information relevant for the component under development.
Information assumed on the operational environment of the component under development shall be available.
For development at the highest level, the cybersecurity concept [WP-09-06] and item definition [WP-09-01] are used instead of higher-level cybersecurity specifications.
Known weaknesses or vulnerabilities from reused components.

description: Cybersecurity specifications shall be defined based on:
a) cybersecurity specifications from higher levels of abstraction;
b) cybersecurity controls selected for implementation, if applicable; and
c) existing architectural design, if applicable.
The defined cybersecurity requirements shall be allocated to components of the architectural design.
Procedures to ensure cybersecurity after component development shall be specified, if applicable.
When selecting design, modelling, or programming notations or languages for cybersecurity specifications or implementation, the following shall be considered:
a) unambiguous and comprehensible syntax and semantics;
b) support for modularity, abstraction, and encapsulation;
c) use of structured constructs;
d) support for secure design and implementation techniques;
e) integration capability with existing components; and
f) resilience of the language against vulnerabilities due to improper use.
Criteria for suitable design, modelling, or programming languages not addressed by the language itself shall be covered by guidelines or the development environment.
The architectural design defined in RQ-10-01 shall be analyzed to identify weaknesses.
Defined cybersecurity specifications shall be verified for completeness, correctness, and consistency with cybersecurity specifications from higher levels of abstraction.
Established and trusted design and implementation principles should be applied to avoid or minimize introduction of weaknesses.
Integration and verification activities shall confirm that the implementation and integration of components fulfil the defined cybersecurity specifications.
Integration and verification activities shall be specified considering:
a) the defined cybersecurity specifications;
b) configurations intended for series production;
c) capability to support functionality defined in the cybersecurity specifications; and
d) conformity with modelling, design, and coding guidelines defined in RQ-10-05.
If verification by testing is adopted, test coverage shall be evaluated using defined coverage metrics to determine sufficiency of test activities.
If testing as described in RC-10-12 is not performed, a rationale shall be provided explaining why testing is not required or feasible.
Testing should be performed to confirm that unidentified weaknesses and vulnerabilities remaining in the component are minimized.
Testing methods may include functional testing, vulnerability scanning, fuzz testing, and penetration testing.

work_products.description: Cybersecurity specifications, resulting from RQ-10-01 and RQ-10-02.
Cybersecurity requirements for post-development, resulting from RQ-10-03.
Documentation of design, modelling, or programming languages and coding guidelines, resulting from RQ-10-04 and RQ-10-05.
Verification report for cybersecurity specifications, resulting from RQ-10-08.
Weaknesses found during product development, resulting from RQ-10-07 and RC-10-12, if applicable.
Integration and verification specification, resulting from RQ-10-10.
Integration and verification report, resulting from RQ-10-09, RQ-10-11, and RC-10-12.
